entry.title: Tobie Goedewaagen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Tobie Goedewaagen (pictured), a minister under the Nazi occupation government, fled the Netherlands with his belongings in a bedspread?

entry.title: Cyprus in the Eurovision Song Contest 2004 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that sixteen-year-old Lisa Andreas, who represented Cyprus in the Eurovision Song Contest 2004, was that year's youngest contest entrant?

entry.title: Chris Patrick (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Chris Patrick is one of seven Stanley Cup champions in his family?

entry.title: Coon Rapids Dam (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Coon Rapids Dam on the Mississippi River is the northern terminus of the river's navigable portion?

entry.title: Henry Donch (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that musician Henry Donch witnessed the assassination of Abraham Lincoln and served on the grand jury that indicted the assassin of President Garfield?

entry.title: Lucario (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Pokémon species Lucario is used to promote fitness programs in Japan?

entry.title: Peter Talbot (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Peter Talbot, the Catholic archbishop of Dublin, was imprisoned in 1678 due to an anti-Catholic conspiracy?

entry.title: Narragansett Pier Railroad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the owners of the Narragansett Pier Railroad included a family of industrialists, a dentist, a systems analyst, a lumberyard, and the founder of Textron?

entry.title: valence populism (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that valence populism cannot be positioned on the left–right political spectrum?

entry.title: Zhang Ziyu (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that 17-year-old women's basketball player Zhang Ziyu is at least 220 centimetres (7 ft 3 in) tall?
